channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @pashulman True.
Your occasional reminder that in Jersey everything is legal as long as you don’t get caught. https://t.co/fgeZjsrRqh
@KnowsMilhouse @benswasey @charlesbethea Petrodollars ruin everything.
@joshtpm @RepMeijer @lrozen Take the US side? On a Congressional salary?
@AkivaMCohen I think she means Prince Albert. Who is busy in the can and can’t run the country. Related: https://t.co/oF7KftQXAC
Courtesy of a press release advertising a local hospital gala, I have located the ideal venue for the next U.S. book launch by @cstross. https://t.co/CpqzWVRUCx

On the one hand, I want to acknowledge an essay by the niece of one of our authors. On the other hand, it's irresponsible to link to a publication which is actively spreading disinformation on important political and medical topics. Not sure that I threaded the needle in the way https://t.co/uVTNwRi4zw
most beneficial to @benyehduapress, but one does have a loyalty to truth and full disclosure.
@johnastoehr @JenniferReitman Sure beats a subpoena.
“Whereas FDR proclaimed of his opponents, “I welcome their hatred,” the modern Democratic Party seems to intone, “Can’t we all just get along?” https://t.co/uWXWYVT3Pv
@MisfitTorah Though to be fair: He is a fundamentally decent person, albeit one hobbled by ideological blinders.
Yet the Mirrer Yeshiva remains open. Mighty suspicious, I say. https://t.co/5os6hF6yUK
@jonathanglick Shhhh!

We applaud the twitter commentators rightly ragging on the Texas Republican congresswoman for failing to make it more difficult for visiting foreign terrorists to get ahold of guns. https://t.co/M5dv7gxpMO
@fentykneel @VictorKoran @ForestandFlame @byKateSmith I think if you look at the historical track record of Southern Baptist politicians, they’re not actually adverse to wars between the states.

@fentykneel @VictorKoran @ForestandFlame @byKateSmith That’s assuming that the rogue Scotus would uphold similar laws passed by California. Trumpian judges may have little minds, but they are not hobgoblinned by consistency.
@ZuckierShlomo Stuck in the forgotten shtetls of out-of-town 20th century America.
@ZuckierShlomo No, actually. Nor instant.
@ZuckierShlomo James vs Yerushalmi?
Republican Party of God approves Georgia bill ending social media repression of Nazi antisemitism. https://t.co/o9T3GOyTvh

Your occasional reminder that the founder of the anti gay bills belongs to a religious denomination, formed to defend chattel slavery, that believes God is going to inflict eternal torment on all Jews for failing to bend the knee before Jesus. https://t.co/MSaUb54i4U
Hard to believe that a once respectable political party would seek common cause with this sect of benighted religious fanatics who worship a horrific, abusive God, but here we are.

Your occasional reminder that under the Republican and Bibi administrations Iran enriched more uranium than ever before. https://t.co/bGMpAmYnhe
Even as Pence’s Party of God continued its decades long effort to enrich corrupt petrostates by fighting fuel efficiency standards and other sane environmental regulations.

@Green_Footballs When one party is pro-virus for whatever nefarious reasons, and the other party tries to remain above politics by not engaging with the other side’s bad-faith arguments, this is what you get.
@Green_Footballs It also helps that Ivy League media people can’t imagine that evil super predators could look like Ivy League media people.

A reminder that the NYTimes and the Atlantic are fundamentally as parochial in terms of targeting a certain ethnic and demographic community as is your local Jewish weekly newspaper. https://t.co/OMtKB87f2T
Good thread on the incentives that lead to the publication of op-Ed by people who claim to have been “silenced” rather than the people who actually are. https://t.co/fQHDIFPKJa
Your reminder that Republicans no longer believe in local government if the locals will vote for Democrats. True in Texas and Pennsylvania. https://t.co/TmJLZPRzPE
